result.markdown:
--- title: "A-3 streams" format: html: css: styles.css --- ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: {.cell} ::: # Reading ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} streams <-read.csv("../../data/Art, Design, and Vocation are all diff-different(Sheet1).csv") print(head(streams)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` SN Degree Course Year Letter.Grade Score Gender 1 1 B.Des CAC 2 A 8.0 F 2 2 B.Des CAC 2 O 9.6 F 3 3 B.Des IADP 2 A+ 9.2 F 4 4 B.Des CE 2 O 9.8 F 5 5 B.Des BSSD 2 P 3.0 M 6 6 B.Des CAC 2 O 9.5 F ``` ::: ::: ## \## Research Question: **Art, Design, and Vocation are all different?** # Munging ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} streams_modified <- streams %>% mutate(Gender = as.factor(Gender)) %>% mutate(Degree = as.factor(Degree))%>% mutate(Letter.Grade = as.factor(Letter.Grade))%>% mutate(Course = as.factor(Course)) ``` ::: # EDA ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gf_histogram(~Score, fill = ~Degree, data = streams_modified, alpha = 0.5, bins = 25 ) %>% gf_vline(xintercept = ~ mean(Score, na.rm = TRUE), linetype = "dashed", color = "red") %>% gf_labs( title = "Histogram of scores across degrees", x = "Scores", y = "Count" ) %>% gf_text( label = "Overall Mean", x = mean(streams_modified$Score, na.rm = TRUE), y = 2, color = "red" ) %>% gf_refine(guides(fill = guide_legend(title = ""))) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gf_boxplot( data = streams_modified, Score ~ Degree, fill = ~Degree, alpha = 0.5 ) %>% gf_vline(xintercept = ~ mean(Score, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% gf_labs( title = "Boxplots of scoress", x = "Degree", y = "Scores", ) %>% gf_refine( scale_x_discrete(guide = "prism_bracket"), guides(fill = guide_legend(title = "")) ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: The S3 guide system was deprecated in ggplot2 3.5.0. ℹ It has been replaced by a ggproto system that can be extended. ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### - median score for bdes is the highest, lowest is b.voc and bfa lies between the two - outliers for b.voc - bvoc distribution is skewed left and bdes skewed right with high concentration of scores on higher end - bfa distribuion seems to be evenly spread out # Anova ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} streams_anova <- aov(Score ~ Degree, data = streams_modified) supernova::pairwise(streams_anova, correction = "Bonferroni", # Try "Tukey" alpha = 0.05, # 95% CI calculation var_equal = TRUE, # We'll see plot = TRUE ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` ── Pairwise t-tests with Bonferroni correction ───────────────────────────────── ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Model: Score ~ Degree ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Degree ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Levels: 3 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Family-wise error-rate: 0.049 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` group_1 group_2 diff pooled_se t df lower upper p_adj 1 B.FA B.Des -0.757 0.201 -3.770 87 -1.191 -0.323 .0009 2 B.Voc B.Des -0.173 0.201 -0.864 87 -0.607 0.261 1.0000 3 B.Voc B.FA 0.583 0.201 2.906 87 0.149 1.017 .0139 ``` ::: ::: ### Inferences - significant difference between the mean scores of B.FA and B.Des. - also a significant difference between the mean scores of B.Voc and B.Des and B.Voc and B.FA.
# B.Des \> B.FA \> B.Voc
